text.#text: Not later than 43 days before any election for Federal office held in a State, the chief State election official of such State shall submit a report to the

Specific information about ballot transmission, including the total numbers of ballot requests received from such voters and ballots transmitted to such voters by the 46th day before the election from each unit of local government that will administer the election.

A State’s compliance with this subparagraph does not bar the Attorney General from seeking additional remedies necessary to effectuate the purposes of this Act.

header.#text: Special rules in case of failure to transmit on time

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in the case in which a valid request for an absentee ballot is received less than 46 days but not less than 30 days before an election for Federal office, the State shall transmit the absentee ballot not later than 3 business days after such request is received.

header.#text: Use of single application for subsequent elections

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 104 of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act/s:104

text.#text: by striking
A State

header.#text: Prohibition of refusal of applications on grounds of early submission

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new subsections:

header.#text: Application treated as valid for subsequent elections

text.#text: If a State accepts and processes a request for an absentee ballot by an absent uniformed services voter or overseas voter and the voter requests that the application be considered an application for an absentee ballot for each subsequent election for Federal office held in the State through the next regularly scheduled general election for Federal office (including any runoff elections which may occur as a result of the outcome of such general election) and any special elections for Federal office held in the State through the calendar year following such general election, the State shall provide an absentee ballot to the voter for each such subsequent election.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not apply with respect to either of the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act/s:104/ss:b/p:1

text.#text: A voter removed from the list of official eligible voters in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Voter Registration Act of 1993/s:8/ss:a/p:3/sp:A
National Voter Registration Act of 1993/s:8/ss:a/p:3/sp:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: (C) of section 8(a)(3) of the National Voter Registration Act of 1993
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Voter Registration Act of 1993/s:8/ss:a/p:3/sp:C

text.#text: A voter whose ballot is returned by mail to the State or local election officials as undeliverable or, in the case of a ballot delivered electronically, if the email sent to the voter was undeliverable or rejected due to an invalid email address.
